name: Daedalus
description: Daedalus had built a maze, but it locked him! Can you survive as long as possible without starving? Find a key and the door to pass to the next challenge. Collect coins, pies and some special items to survive in this hypercasual 2D mobile game.
prizes: Published temporarily by Manifesto Games in 2019

name: O Bom Mau Sentimento
description: A boy is conflicting internally with Tristeza (Sadness) and his mind is currently a mess. Can you help him to find peace with this sentiment? Pass through the puzzles avoiding spikes and reach the end.

name: Infernal Tetris
description: The classic puzzle, with a slight difference: the randomness will get crazy at some point. Can you score?

name: Timber!!!
description: Inspired by the classic Timberman, chop the maximum number of branches (following the music!) you can avoiding being smashed!

name: Mining Framework
description: Extensible tool for mining and analysing Git projects, where the developer can implement a commit filter, a data analyser, a project preprocessor and an output processor.

name: Journi
description: A platform to help students to choose an university and a course based on its expectatives, with collaboration of people already inside these environments.
prizes: Gained Honorable Mention of Best General Project in 2019 at Porto Digital - Recife

name: Bézier Curves Intersection
description: An interactive tool to create and modify up to two Bézier curves, also highlighting their intersection points.

name: Random Texture by Coloration
description: An interactive tool to build a 3D object and apply a random texture on it by choosing colors.

name: Path Tracer
description: A path tracer that renders a given input scene, solving Kagiya's Rendering Equation using Monte Carlo integration technique.

name: Online Search
description: An interactive tool to transport a robot from a starting point to an end point, implementing A* algorithm.

name: Logic Calculator
description: A calculator to solve instances of The Satisfiability Problem for both Propositional and First-Order Logic, implementing the Resolution Method.

name: Apostila de Lógica
description: A material to help Mathematical Logic for Computation students, teaching in a more understadable way hard concepts.
